text:
TITLE:
   ISSUES:
   - Left distal femur fracture
   - Right tib-fib fracture
   - Mesenteric hematoma
   - Multiple rib fractures
   - Sternal fracture
   - T8 vertebral body fracture
   .
   24 HOUR EVENTS:
   [**12-15**]: foley replaced; vanco to continue for the next 2 days -> then
   switch to nafcillin for MSSA pna; TF held in anticipation of OR --> to
   go [**12-16**] with trauma for trach/PED/IVC; IVF changed to D51/2NS w/K as Na
   rising
   Trauma, s/p (see above)
   Assessment:
   Hct down to 22.7 (24), pedal pulses dopplerable/good cap refill in both
   [**Name (NI) **], pt still able to move all extremitites purposefully.
   Action:
   L knee immobilizer, R ex-fix intact-pin care provided. Pulses monitored
   Q4. Reverse T-[**Doctor Last Name **]/logroll prec. maintained.
   Response:
   Ortho injuries stable-ORIF Mon. [**12-19**].
   Plan:
   Plan for trach/peg.ivc filter on Mon. clamshell brace when hob>30
   Pain control (acute pain, chronic pain)
   Assessment:
   Appears to be in pain as evidenced by hyperdynamics with stimuli as
   well as restlessness, proceeded by coughing on ETT. Nods yes most of
   the time when asked if experiencing any pain.
   Action:
   Fentanyl and Midazolam gtts-with occasional boluses after turning or
   oral care required. Frequent re-orientation provided.
   Response:
   Pt appears comfortable with above meds, and responds well to RN
   re-orientation and support.
   Plan:
   Continue sedation/pain management until post-op.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Persistant cuff leak from ETT, Vts majority of time have not been
   affected. Lungs clear and equal/diminished bibasilar. ABG WNL.
   Action:
   Sxnd for sm amts thick yellow secretions from ETT. No vent changes made
   in anticipation for OR today. Pt required multiple boluses to settle
   overnight-due to biting of ETT/coughing, and cuff leak.
   Response:
   With adequate sedation pt
s resp status stable.
   Plan:
   Trach @ 10am today-wean vent as tol post-op., cont. pulmonary hygiene,
   as well as Vanco for +sputum cx.
